intro: Cerinthe gymnandra, commonly known as the yellow horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Western Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers, which are surrounded by two prominent, horn-like bracts. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cerinthe gymnandra is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the opium poppy.
